level.text: The following weight classifications for boxers are hereby established:
Flyweight, at least one hundred twelve pounds (112 lbs.) but not more than one hundred seventeen pounds (117 lbs.);
Bantamweight, over one hundred seventeen pounds (117 lbs.) but not more than one hundred twenty-five pounds (125 lbs.);
Featherweight, over one hundred twenty-five pounds (125 lbs.) but not more than one hundred thirty-four pounds (134 lbs.);
Lightweight, over one hundred thirty-four pounds (134 lbs.) but not more than one hundred forty-five pounds (145 lbs.);
Welterweight, over one hundred forty-five pounds (145 lbs.) but not more than one hundred fifty-nine pounds (159 lbs.);
Middleweight, over one hundred fifty-nine pounds (159 lbs.) but not more than one hundred seventy-three pounds (173 lbs.);
Light heavyweight, over one hundred seventy-three pounds (173 lbs.) but not more than one hundred eighty-nine pounds (189 lbs.);
Cruiserweight, over one hundred eighty-nine pounds (189 lbs.) but not more than one hundred ninety-five pounds (195 lbs.);
Heavyweight, over one hundred ninety-five pounds (195 lbs.).

The Commission may, further recognize subcategories of the categories established in this section according to the rules of the association or federation under whose auspices a championship contest is held.
The following weight spreads are permissible for matchmaking in boxing events within each weight classification:
Flyweight, no limit;
Bantamweight, not more than four pounds (4 lbs.);
Featherweight, not more than five pounds (5 lbs.);
Lightweight, not more than six pounds (6 lbs.);
Welterweight, not more than seven pounds (7 lbs.);
Middleweight, not more than eight pounds (8 lbs.);
Light heavyweight, not more than ten pounds (10 lbs.);
Cruiserweight, not more than twelve pounds (12 lbs.); and
Heavyweight, no limit.
The Commission may waive the requirements of ยง 2107.3 for good cause.
